2548 * double arithmetic. This preserves the accuracy while
2549 * retaining the 68-year span.
2550 *
2551 * There are three interleaving schemes, basic, interleaved
2552 * symmetric and interleaved broadcast. The timestamps are
2553 * idioscyncratically different. See the onwire briefing/white
2554 * paper at www.eecis.udel.edu/~mills for details.
2555 *
2556 * Interleaved symmetric mode
2557 * t1 = peer->aorg/borg, t2 = peer->rec, t3 = p_xmt,
2558 * t4 = peer->dst
2559 */
2560 if (peer->flip != 0) {
2561 ci = p_xmt; /* t3 - t4 */
2562 L_SUB(&ci, &peer->dst);
2563 LFPTOD(&ci, t34);
2564 ci = p_rec; /* t2 - t1 */
2565 if (peer->flip > 0)
2566 L_SUB(&ci, &peer->borg);
2567 else
2568 L_SUB(&ci, &peer->aorg);
2569 LFPTOD(&ci, t21);
2570 p_del = t21 - t34;
2571 p_offset = (t21 + t34) / 2.;
2572 if (p_del < 0 || p_del > 1.) {
2573 snprintf(statstr, sizeof(statstr),
2574 "t21 %.6f t34 %.6f", t21, t34);
2575 report_event(PEVNT_XERR, peer, statstr);
2576 return;
2577 }
2578
2579 /*
2580 * Broadcast modes
2581 */
2582 } else if (peer->pmode == MODE_BROADCAST) {
2583
2584 /*
2585 * Interleaved broadcast mode. Use interleaved timestamps.
2586 * t1 = peer->borg, t2 = p_org, t3 = p_org, t4 = aorg
2587 */
2588 if (peer->flags & FLAG_XB) {
2589 ci = p_org; /* delay */
2590 L_SUB(&ci, &peer->aorg);
2591 LFPTOD(&ci, t34);
2592 ci = p_org; /* t2 - t1 */
2593 L_SUB(&ci, &peer->borg);
2594 LFPTOD(&ci, t21);
2595 peer->aorg = p_xmt;
2596 peer->borg = peer->dst;
2597 if (t34 < 0 || t34 > 1.) {
2598 /* drop all if in the initial volley */
2599 if (FLAG_BC_VOL & peer->flags)
2600 goto bcc_init_volley_fail;
2601 snprintf(statstr, sizeof(statstr),
2602 "offset %.6f delay %.6f", t21, t34);
2603 report_event(PEVNT_XERR, peer, statstr);
2604 return;
2605 }
2606 p_offset = t21;
2607 peer->xleave = t34;
2608
2609 /*
2610 * Basic broadcast - use direct timestamps.
2611 * t3 = p_xmt, t4 = peer->dst
2612 */
2613 } else {
2614 ci = p_xmt; /* t3 - t4 */
2615 L_SUB(&ci, &peer->dst);
2616 LFPTOD(&ci, t34);
2617 p_offset = t34;
2618 }
2619
2620 /*
2621 * When calibration is complete and the clock is
2622 * synchronized, the bias is calculated as the difference
2623 * between the unicast timestamp and the broadcast
2624 * timestamp. This works for both basic and interleaved
2625 * modes.
2626 * [Bug 3031] Don't keep this peer when the delay
2627 * calculation gives reason to suspect clock steps.
2628 * This is assumed for delays > 50ms.
2629 */
2630 if (FLAG_BC_VOL & peer->flags) {
2631 peer->flags &= ~FLAG_BC_VOL;
2632 peer->delay = fabs(peer->offset - p_offset) * 2;
2633 DPRINTF(2, ("broadcast volley: initial delay=%.6f\n",
2634 peer->delay));
2635 if (peer->delay > fabs(sys_bdelay)) {
2636 bcc_init_volley_fail:
2637 DPRINTF(2, ("%s", "broadcast volley: initial delay exceeds limit\n"));
2638 unpeer(peer);
2639 return;
2640 }
2641 }
2642 peer->nextdate = current_time + (1u << peer->ppoll) - 2u;
2643 p_del = peer->delay;
2644 p_offset += p_del / 2;
2645
2646
2647 /*
2648 * Basic mode, otherwise known as the old fashioned way.
2649 *
2650 * t1 = p_org, t2 = p_rec, t3 = p_xmt, t4 = peer->dst
2651 */
2652 } else {
2653 ci = p_xmt; /* t3 - t4 */
2654 L_SUB(&ci, &peer->dst);
2655 LFPTOD(&ci, t34);
2656 ci = p_rec; /* t2 - t1 */
2657 L_SUB(&ci, &p_org);
2658 LFPTOD(&ci, t21);
2659 p_del = fabs(t21 - t34);
2660 p_offset = (t21 + t34) / 2.;
2661 }
2662 p_del = max(p_del, LOGTOD(sys_precision));
2663 p_disp = LOGTOD(sys_precision) + LOGTOD(peer->precision) +
2664 clock_phi * p_del;
2665
2666#if ASSYM
2667 /*
2668 * This code calculates the outbound and inbound data rates by
2669 * measuring the differences between timestamps at different
2670 * packet lengths. This is helpful in cases of large asymmetric
2671 * delays commonly experienced on deep space communication
2672 * links.
2673 */
2674 if (peer->t21_last > 0 && peer->t34_bytes > 0) {
2675 itemp = peer->t21_bytes - peer->t21_last;
2676 if (itemp > 25) {
2677 etemp = t21 - peer->t21;
2678 if (fabs(etemp) > 1e-6) {
2679 ftemp = itemp / etemp;
2680 if (ftemp > 1000.)
2681 peer->r21 = ftemp;
2682 }
2683 }
2684 itemp = len - peer->t34_bytes;
2685 if (itemp > 25) {
2686 etemp = -t34 - peer->t34;
2687 if (fabs(etemp) > 1e-6) {
2688 ftemp = itemp / etemp;
2689 if (ftemp > 1000.)
2690 peer->r34 = ftemp;
2691 }
2692 }
2693 }
2694
2695 /*
2696 * The following section compensates for different data rates on
2697 * the outbound (d21) and inbound (t34) directions. To do this,
2698 * it finds t such that r21 * t - r34 * (d - t) = 0, where d is
2699 * the roundtrip delay. Then it calculates the correction as a
2700 * fraction of d.
2701 */
2702 peer->t21 = t21;
2703 peer->t21_last = peer->t21_bytes;
2704 peer->t34 = -t34;
2705 peer->t34_bytes = len;
2706 DPRINTF(2, ("packet: t21 %.9lf %d t34 %.9lf %d\n", peer->t21,
2707 peer->t21_bytes, peer->t34, peer->t34_bytes));
2708 if (peer->r21 > 0 && peer->r34 > 0 && p_del > 0) {
2709 if (peer->pmode != MODE_BROADCAST)
2710 td = (peer->r34 / (peer->r21 + peer->r34) -
2711 .5) * p_del;
2712 else
2713 td = 0;
2714
2715 /*
2716 * Unfortunately, in many cases the errors are
2717 * unacceptable, so for the present the rates are not
2718 * used. In future, we might find conditions where the
2719 * calculations are useful, so this should be considered
2720 * a work in progress.
2721 */
2722 t21 -= td;
2723 t34 -= td;
2724 DPRINTF(2, ("packet: del %.6lf r21 %.1lf r34 %.1lf %.6lf\n",
2725 p_del, peer->r21 / 1e3, peer->r34 / 1e3,
2726 td));
2727 }
2728#endif /* ASSYM */
2729
2730 /*
2731 * That was awesome. Now hand off to the clock filter.
2732 */
2733 clock_filter(peer, p_offset + peer->bias, p_del, p_disp);
2734
2735 /*
2736 * If we are in broadcast calibrate mode, return to broadcast
2737 * client mode when the client is fit and the autokey dance is
2738 * complete.
2739 */
2740 if ( (FLAG_BC_VOL & peer->flags)
2741 && MODE_CLIENT == peer->hmode
2742 && !(TEST11 & peer_unfit(peer))) { /* distance exceeded */
2743#ifdef AUTOKEY
2744 if (peer->flags & FLAG_SKEY) {
2745 if (!(~peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_ALL))
2746 peer->hmode = MODE_BCLIENT;
2747 } else {
2748 peer->hmode = MODE_BCLIENT;
2749 }
2750#else /* !AUTOKEY follows */
2751 peer->hmode = MODE_BCLIENT;
2752#endif /* !AUTOKEY */
2753 }
2754}
2755
2756
2757/*
2758 * clock_update - Called at system process update intervals.
2759 */
2760static void
2761clock_update(
2762 struct peer *peer /* peer structure pointer */
2763 )
2764{
2765 double dtemp;
2766 l_fp now;
2767#ifdef HAVE_LIBSCF_H
2768 char *fmri;
2769#endif /* HAVE_LIBSCF_H */
2770
2771 /*
2772 * Update the system state variables. We do this very carefully,
2773 * as the poll interval might need to be clamped differently.
2774 */
2775 sys_peer = peer;
2776 sys_epoch = peer->epoch;
2777 if (sys_poll < peer->minpoll)
2778 sys_poll = peer->minpoll;
2779 if (sys_poll > peer->maxpoll)
2780 sys_poll = peer->maxpoll;
2781 poll_update(peer, sys_poll);
2782 sys_stratum = min(peer->stratum + 1, STRATUM_UNSPEC);
2783 if ( peer->stratum == STRATUM_REFCLOCK
2784 || peer->stratum == STRATUM_UNSPEC)
2785 sys_refid = peer->refid;
2786 else
2787 sys_refid = addr2refid(&peer->srcadr);
2788 /*
2789 * Root Dispersion (E) is defined (in RFC 5905) as:
2790 *
2791 * E = p.epsilon_r + p.epsilon + p.psi + PHI*(s.t - p.t) + |THETA|
2792 *
2793 * where:
2794 * p.epsilon_r is the PollProc's root dispersion
2795 * p.epsilon is the PollProc's dispersion
2796 * p.psi is the PollProc's jitter
2797 * THETA is the combined offset
2798 *
2799 * NB: Think Hard about where these numbers come from and
2800 * what they mean. When did peer->update happen? Has anything
2801 * interesting happened since then? What values are the most
2802 * defensible? Why?
2803 *
2804 * DLM thinks this equation is probably the best of all worse choices.
2805 */
2806 dtemp = peer->rootdisp
2807 + peer->disp
2808 + sys_jitter
2809 + clock_phi * (current_time - peer->update)
2810 + fabs(sys_offset);
2811
2812 if (dtemp > sys_mindisp)
2813 sys_rootdisp = dtemp;
2814 else
2815 sys_rootdisp = sys_mindisp;
2816 sys_rootdelay = peer->delay + peer->rootdelay;
2817 sys_reftime = peer->dst;
2818
2819 DPRINTF(1, ("clock_update: at %lu sample %lu associd %d\n",
2820 current_time, peer->epoch, peer->associd));
2821
2822 /*
2823 * Comes now the moment of truth. Crank the clock discipline and
2824 * see what comes out.
2825 */
2826 switch (local_clock(peer, sys_offset)) {
2827
2828 /*
2829 * Clock exceeds panic threshold. Life as we know it ends.
2830 */
2831 case -1:
2832#ifdef HAVE_LIBSCF_H
2833 /*
2834 * For Solaris enter the maintenance mode.
2835 */
2836 if ((fmri = getenv("SMF_FMRI")) != NULL) {
2837 if (smf_maintain_instance(fmri, 0) < 0) {
2838 printf("smf_maintain_instance: %s\n",
2839 scf_strerror(scf_error()));
2840 exit(1);
2841 }
2842 /*
2843 * Sleep until SMF kills us.
2844 */
2845 for (;;)
2846 pause();
2847 }
2848#endif /* HAVE_LIBSCF_H */
2849 exit (-1);
2850 /* not reached */
2851
2852 /*
2853 * Clock was stepped. Flush all time values of all peers.
2854 */
2855 case 2:
2856 clear_all();
2857 set_sys_leap(LEAP_NOTINSYNC);
2858 sys_stratum = STRATUM_UNSPEC;
2859 memcpy(&sys_refid, "STEP", 4);
2860 sys_rootdelay = 0;
2861 sys_rootdisp = 0;
2862 L_CLR(&sys_reftime);
2863 sys_jitter = LOGTOD(sys_precision);
2864 leapsec_reset_frame();
2865 break;
2866
2867 /*
2868 * Clock was slewed. Handle the leapsecond stuff.
2869 */
2870 case 1:
2871
2872 /*
2873 * If this is the first time the clock is set, reset the
2874 * leap bits. If crypto, the timer will goose the setup
2875 * process.
2876 */
2877 if (sys_leap == LEAP_NOTINSYNC) {
2878 set_sys_leap(LEAP_NOWARNING);
2879#ifdef AUTOKEY
2880 if (crypto_flags)
2881 crypto_update();
2882#endif /* AUTOKEY */
2883 /*
2884 * If our parent process is waiting for the
2885 * first clock sync, send them home satisfied.
2886 */
2887#ifdef HAVE_WORKING_FORK
2888 if (waitsync_fd_to_close != -1) {
2889 close(waitsync_fd_to_close);
2890 waitsync_fd_to_close = -1;
2891 DPRINTF(1, ("notified parent --wait-sync is done\n"));
2892 }
2893#endif /* HAVE_WORKING_FORK */
2894
2895 }
2896
2897 /*
2898 * If there is no leap second pending and the number of
2899 * survivor leap bits is greater than half the number of
2900 * survivors, try to schedule a leap for the end of the
2901 * current month. (This only works if no leap second for
2902 * that range is in the table, so doing this more than
2903 * once is mostly harmless.)
2904 */
2905 if (leapsec == LSPROX_NOWARN) {
2906 if ( leap_vote_ins > leap_vote_del
2907 && leap_vote_ins > sys_survivors / 2) {
2908 get_systime(&now);
2909 leapsec_add_dyn(TRUE, now.l_ui, NULL);
2910 }
2911 if ( leap_vote_del > leap_vote_ins
2912 && leap_vote_del > sys_survivors / 2) {
2913 get_systime(&now);
2914 leapsec_add_dyn(FALSE, now.l_ui, NULL);
2915 }
2916 }
2917 break;
2918
2919 /*
2920 * Popcorn spike or step threshold exceeded. Pretend it never
2921 * happened.
2922 */
2923 default:
2924 break;
2925 }
2926}
2927
2928
2929/*
2930 * poll_update - update peer poll interval
2931 */
2932void
2933poll_update(
2934 struct peer *peer, /* peer structure pointer */
2935 u_char mpoll
2936 )
2937{
2938 u_long next, utemp;
2939 u_char hpoll;
2940
2941 /*
2942 * This routine figures out when the next poll should be sent.
2943 * That turns out to be wickedly complicated. One problem is
2944 * that sometimes the time for the next poll is in the past when
2945 * the poll interval is reduced. We watch out for races here
2946 * between the receive process and the poll process.
2947 *
2948 * Clamp the poll interval between minpoll and maxpoll.
2949 */
2950 hpoll = max(min(peer->maxpoll, mpoll), peer->minpoll);
2951
2952#ifdef AUTOKEY
2953 /*
2954 * If during the crypto protocol the poll interval has changed,
2955 * the lifetimes in the key list are probably bogus. Purge the
2956 * the key list and regenerate it later.
2957 */
2958 if ((peer->flags & FLAG_SKEY) && hpoll != peer->hpoll)
2959 key_expire(peer);
2960#endif /* AUTOKEY */
2961 peer->hpoll = hpoll;
2962
2963 /*
2964 * There are three variables important for poll scheduling, the
2965 * current time (current_time), next scheduled time (nextdate)
2966 * and the earliest time (utemp). The earliest time is 2 s
2967 * seconds, but could be more due to rate management. When
2968 * sending in a burst, use the earliest time. When not in a
2969 * burst but with a reply pending, send at the earliest time
2970 * unless the next scheduled time has not advanced. This can
2971 * only happen if multiple replies are pending in the same
2972 * response interval. Otherwise, send at the later of the next
2973 * scheduled time and the earliest time.
2974 *
2975 * Now we figure out if there is an override. If a burst is in
2976 * progress and we get called from the receive process, just
2977 * slink away. If called from the poll process, delay 1 s for a
2978 * reference clock, otherwise 2 s.
2979 */
2980 utemp = current_time + max(peer->throttle - (NTP_SHIFT - 1) *
2981 (1 << peer->minpoll), ntp_minpkt);
2982 if (peer->burst > 0) {
2983 if (peer->nextdate > current_time)
2984 return;
2985#ifdef REFCLOCK
2986 else if (peer->flags & FLAG_REFCLOCK)
2987 peer->nextdate = current_time + RESP_DELAY;
2988#endif /* REFCLOCK */
2989 else
2990 peer->nextdate = utemp;
2991
2992#ifdef AUTOKEY
2993 /*
2994 * If a burst is not in progress and a crypto response message
2995 * is pending, delay 2 s, but only if this is a new interval.
2996 */
2997 } else if (peer->cmmd != NULL) {
2998 if (peer->nextdate > current_time) {
2999 if (peer->nextdate + ntp_minpkt != utemp)
3000 peer->nextdate = utemp;
3001 } else {
3002 peer->nextdate = utemp;
3003 }
3004#endif /* AUTOKEY */
3005
3006 /*
3007 * The ordinary case. If a retry, use minpoll; if unreachable,
3008 * use host poll; otherwise, use the minimum of host and peer
3009 * polls; In other words, oversampling is okay but
3010 * understampling is evil. Use the maximum of this value and the
3011 * headway. If the average headway is greater than the headway
3012 * threshold, increase the headway by the minimum interval.
3013 */
3014 } else {
3015 if (peer->retry > 0)
3016 hpoll = peer->minpoll;
3017 else
3018 hpoll = min(peer->ppoll, peer->hpoll);
3019#ifdef REFCLOCK
3020 if (peer->flags & FLAG_REFCLOCK)
3021 next = 1 << hpoll;
3022 else
3023#endif /* REFCLOCK */
3024 next = ((0x1000UL | (ntp_random() & 0x0ff)) <<
3025 hpoll) >> 12;
3026 next += peer->outdate;
3027 if (next > utemp)
3028 peer->nextdate = next;
3029 else
3030 peer->nextdate = utemp;
3031 if (peer->throttle > (1 << peer->minpoll))
3032 peer->nextdate += ntp_minpkt;
3033 }
3034 DPRINTF(2, ("poll_update: at %lu %s poll %d burst %d retry %d head %d early %lu next %lu\n",
3035 current_time, ntoa(&peer->srcadr), peer->hpoll,
3036 peer->burst, peer->retry, peer->throttle,
3037 utemp - current_time, peer->nextdate -
3038 current_time));
3039}
3040
3041
3042/*
3043 * peer_clear - clear peer filter registers. See Section 3.4.8 of the
3044 * spec.
3045 */
3046void
3047peer_clear(
3048 struct peer *peer, /* peer structure */
3049 const char *ident /* tally lights */
3050 )
3051{
3052 u_char u;
3053 l_fp bxmt = peer->bxmt; /* bcast clients retain this! */
3054
3055#ifdef AUTOKEY
3056 /*
3057 * If cryptographic credentials have been acquired, toss them to
3058 * Valhalla. Note that autokeys are ephemeral, in that they are
3059 * tossed immediately upon use. Therefore, the keylist can be
3060 * purged anytime without needing to preserve random keys. Note
3061 * that, if the peer is purged, the cryptographic variables are
3062 * purged, too. This makes it much harder to sneak in some
3063 * unauthenticated data in the clock filter.
3064 */
3065 key_expire(peer);
3066 if (peer->iffval != NULL)
3067 BN_free(peer->iffval);
3068 value_free(&peer->cookval);
3069 value_free(&peer->recval);
3070 value_free(&peer->encrypt);
3071 value_free(&peer->sndval);
3072 if (peer->cmmd != NULL)
3073 free(peer->cmmd);
3074 if (peer->subject != NULL)
3075 free(peer->subject);
3076 if (peer->issuer != NULL)
3077 free(peer->issuer);
3078#endif /* AUTOKEY */
3079
3080 /*
3081 * Clear all values, including the optional crypto values above.
3082 */
3083 memset(CLEAR_TO_ZERO(peer), 0, LEN_CLEAR_TO_ZERO(peer));
3084 peer->ppoll = peer->maxpoll;
3085 peer->hpoll = peer->minpoll;
3086 peer->disp = MAXDISPERSE;
3087 peer->flash = peer_unfit(peer);
3088 peer->jitter = LOGTOD(sys_precision);
3089
3090 /* Don't throw away our broadcast replay protection */
3091 if (peer->hmode == MODE_BCLIENT)
3092 peer->bxmt = bxmt;
3093
3094 /*
3095 * If interleave mode, initialize the alternate origin switch.
3096 */
3097 if (peer->flags & FLAG_XLEAVE)
3098 peer->flip = 1;
3099 for (u = 0; u < NTP_SHIFT; u++) {
3100 peer->filter_order[u] = u;
3101 peer->filter_disp[u] = MAXDISPERSE;
3102 }
3103#ifdef REFCLOCK
3104 if (!(peer->flags & FLAG_REFCLOCK)) {
3105#endif
3106 peer->leap = LEAP_NOTINSYNC;
3107 peer->stratum = STRATUM_UNSPEC;
3108 memcpy(&peer->refid, ident, 4);
3109#ifdef REFCLOCK
3110 } else {
3111 /* Clear refclock sample filter */
3112 peer->procptr->codeproc = 0;
3113 peer->procptr->coderecv = 0;
3114 }
3115#endif
3116
3117 /*
3118 * During initialization use the association count to spread out
3119 * the polls at one-second intervals. Passive associations'
3120 * first poll is delayed by the "discard minimum" to avoid rate
3121 * limiting. Other post-startup new or cleared associations
3122 * randomize the first poll over the minimum poll interval to
3123 * avoid implosion.
3124 */
3125 peer->nextdate = peer->update = peer->outdate = current_time;
3126 if (initializing) {
3127 peer->nextdate += peer_associations;
3128 } else if (MODE_PASSIVE == peer->hmode) {
3129 peer->nextdate += ntp_minpkt;
3130 } else {
3131 peer->nextdate += ntp_random() % peer->minpoll;
3132 }
3133#ifdef AUTOKEY
3134 peer->refresh = current_time + (1 << NTP_REFRESH);
3135#endif /* AUTOKEY */
3136 DPRINTF(1, ("peer_clear: at %ld next %ld associd %d refid %s\n",
3137 current_time, peer->nextdate, peer->associd,
3138 ident));
3139}
3140
3141
3142/*
3143 * clock_filter - add incoming clock sample to filter register and run
3144 * the filter procedure to find the best sample.
3145 */
3146void
3147clock_filter(
3148 struct peer *peer, /* peer structure pointer */
3149 double sample_offset, /* clock offset */
3150 double sample_delay, /* roundtrip delay */
3151 double sample_disp /* dispersion */
3152 )
3153{
3154 double dst[NTP_SHIFT]; /* distance vector */
3155 int ord[NTP_SHIFT]; /* index vector */
3156 int i, j, k, m;
3157 double dtemp, etemp;
3158 char tbuf[80];
3159
3160 /*
3161 * A sample consists of the offset, delay, dispersion and epoch
3162 * of arrival. The offset and delay are determined by the on-
3163 * wire protocol. The dispersion grows from the last outbound
3164 * packet to the arrival of this one increased by the sum of the
3165 * peer precision and the system precision as required by the
3166 * error budget. First, shift the new arrival into the shift
3167 * register discarding the oldest one.
3168 */
3169 j = peer->filter_nextpt;
3170 peer->filter_offset[j] = sample_offset;
3171 peer->filter_delay[j] = sample_delay;
3172 peer->filter_disp[j] = sample_disp;
3173 peer->filter_epoch[j] = current_time;
3174 j = (j + 1) % NTP_SHIFT;
3175 peer->filter_nextpt = j;
3176
3177 /*
3178 * Update dispersions since the last update and at the same
3179 * time initialize the distance and index lists. Since samples
3180 * become increasingly uncorrelated beyond the Allan intercept,
3181 * only under exceptional cases will an older sample be used.
3182 * Therefore, the distance list uses a compound metric. If the
3183 * dispersion is greater than the maximum dispersion, clamp the
3184 * distance at that value. If the time since the last update is
3185 * less than the Allan intercept use the delay; otherwise, use
3186 * the sum of the delay and dispersion.
3187 */
3188 dtemp = clock_phi * (current_time - peer->update);
3189 peer->update = current_time;
3190 for (i = NTP_SHIFT - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
3191 if (i != 0)
3192 peer->filter_disp[j] += dtemp;
3193 if (peer->filter_disp[j] >= MAXDISPERSE) {
3194 peer->filter_disp[j] = MAXDISPERSE;
3195 dst[i] = MAXDISPERSE;
3196 } else if (peer->update - peer->filter_epoch[j] >
3197 (u_long)ULOGTOD(allan_xpt)) {
3198 dst[i] = peer->filter_delay[j] +
3199 peer->filter_disp[j];
3200 } else {
3201 dst[i] = peer->filter_delay[j];
3202 }
3203 ord[i] = j;
3204 j = (j + 1) % NTP_SHIFT;
3205 }
3206
3207 /*
3208 * If the clock has stabilized, sort the samples by distance.
3209 */
3210 if (freq_cnt == 0) {
3211 for (i = 1; i < NTP_SHIFT; i++) {
3212 for (j = 0; j < i; j++) {
3213 if (dst[j] > dst[i]) {
3214 k = ord[j];
3215 ord[j] = ord[i];
3216 ord[i] = k;
3217 etemp = dst[j];
3218 dst[j] = dst[i];
3219 dst[i] = etemp;
3220 }
3221 }
3222 }
3223 }
3224
3225 /*
3226 * Copy the index list to the association structure so ntpq
3227 * can see it later. Prune the distance list to leave only
3228 * samples less than the maximum dispersion, which disfavors
3229 * uncorrelated samples older than the Allan intercept. To
3230 * further improve the jitter estimate, of the remainder leave
3231 * only samples less than the maximum distance, but keep at
3232 * least two samples for jitter calculation.
3233 */
3234 m = 0;
3235 for (i = 0; i < NTP_SHIFT; i++) {
3236 peer->filter_order[i] = (u_char) ord[i];
3237 if ( dst[i] >= MAXDISPERSE
3238 || (m >= 2 && dst[i] >= sys_maxdist))
3239 continue;
3240 m++;
3241 }
3242
3243 /*
3244 * Compute the dispersion and jitter. The dispersion is weighted
3245 * exponentially by NTP_FWEIGHT (0.5) so it is normalized close
3246 * to 1.0. The jitter is the RMS differences relative to the
3247 * lowest delay sample.
3248 */
3249 peer->disp = peer->jitter = 0;
3250 k = ord[0];
3251 for (i = NTP_SHIFT - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
3252 j = ord[i];
3253 peer->disp = NTP_FWEIGHT * (peer->disp +
3254 peer->filter_disp[j]);
3255 if (i < m)
3256 peer->jitter += DIFF(peer->filter_offset[j],
3257 peer->filter_offset[k]);
3258 }
3259
3260 /*
3261 * If no acceptable samples remain in the shift register,
3262 * quietly tiptoe home leaving only the dispersion. Otherwise,
3263 * save the offset, delay and jitter. Note the jitter must not
3264 * be less than the precision.
3265 */
3266 if (m == 0) {
3267 clock_select();
3268 return;
3269 }
3270 etemp = fabs(peer->offset - peer->filter_offset[k]);
3271 peer->offset = peer->filter_offset[k];
3272 peer->delay = peer->filter_delay[k];
3273 if (m > 1)
3274 peer->jitter /= m - 1;
3275 peer->jitter = max(SQRT(peer->jitter), LOGTOD(sys_precision));
3276
3277 /*
3278 * If the the new sample and the current sample are both valid
3279 * and the difference between their offsets exceeds CLOCK_SGATE
3280 * (3) times the jitter and the interval between them is less
3281 * than twice the host poll interval, consider the new sample
3282 * a popcorn spike and ignore it.
3283 */
3284 if ( peer->disp < sys_maxdist
3285 && peer->filter_disp[k] < sys_maxdist
3286 && etemp > CLOCK_SGATE * peer->jitter
3287 && peer->filter_epoch[k] - peer->epoch
3288 < 2. * ULOGTOD(peer->hpoll)) {
3289 snprintf(tbuf, sizeof(tbuf), "%.6f s", etemp);
3290 report_event(PEVNT_POPCORN, peer, tbuf);
3291 return;
3292 }
3293
3294 /*
3295 * A new minimum sample is useful only if it is later than the
3296 * last one used. In this design the maximum lifetime of any
3297 * sample is not greater than eight times the poll interval, so
3298 * the maximum interval between minimum samples is eight
3299 * packets.
3300 */
3301 if (peer->filter_epoch[k] <= peer->epoch) {
3302 DPRINTF(2, ("clock_filter: old sample %lu\n", current_time -
3303 peer->filter_epoch[k]));
3304 return;
3305 }
3306 peer->epoch = peer->filter_epoch[k];
3307
3308 /*
3309 * The mitigated sample statistics are saved for later
3310 * processing. If not synchronized or not in a burst, tickle the
3311 * clock select algorithm.
3312 */
3313 record_peer_stats(&peer->srcadr, ctlpeerstatus(peer),
3314 peer->offset, peer->delay, peer->disp, peer->jitter);
3315 DPRINTF(1, ("clock_filter: n %d off %.6f del %.6f dsp %.6f jit %.6f\n",
3316 m, peer->offset, peer->delay, peer->disp,
3317 peer->jitter));
3318 if (peer->burst == 0 || sys_leap == LEAP_NOTINSYNC)
3319 clock_select();
3320}
3321
3322
3323/*
3324 * clock_select - find the pick-of-the-litter clock
3325 *
3326 * LOCKCLOCK: (1) If the local clock is the prefer peer, it will always
3327 * be enabled, even if declared falseticker, (2) only the prefer peer
3328 * can be selected as the system peer, (3) if the external source is
3329 * down, the system leap bits are set to 11 and the stratum set to
3330 * infinity.
3331 */
3332void
3333clock_select(void)
3334{
3335 struct peer *peer;
3336 int i, j, k, n;
3337 int nlist, nl2;
3338 int allow;
3339 int speer;
3340 double d, e, f, g;
3341 double high, low;
3342 double speermet;
3343 double orphmet = 2.0 * U_INT32_MAX; /* 2x is greater than */
3344 struct endpoint endp;
3345 struct peer *osys_peer;
3346 struct peer *sys_prefer = NULL; /* prefer peer */
3347 struct peer *typesystem = NULL;
3348 struct peer *typeorphan = NULL;
3349#ifdef REFCLOCK
3350 struct peer *typeacts = NULL;
3351 struct peer *typelocal = NULL;
3352 struct peer *typepps = NULL;
3353#endif /* REFCLOCK */
3354 static struct endpoint *endpoint = NULL;
3355 static int *indx = NULL;
3356 static peer_select *peers = NULL;
3357 static u_int endpoint_size = 0;
3358 static u_int peers_size = 0;
3359 static u_int indx_size = 0;
3360 size_t octets;
3361
3362 /*
3363 * Initialize and create endpoint, index and peer lists big
3364 * enough to handle all associations.
3365 */
3366 osys_peer = sys_peer;
3367 sys_survivors = 0;
3368#ifdef LOCKCLOCK
3369 set_sys_leap(LEAP_NOTINSYNC);
3370 sys_stratum = STRATUM_UNSPEC;
3371 memcpy(&sys_refid, "DOWN", 4);
3372#endif /* LOCKCLOCK */
3373
3374 /*
3375 * Allocate dynamic space depending on the number of
3376 * associations.
3377 */
3378 nlist = 1;
3379 for (peer = peer_list; peer != NULL; peer = peer->p_link)
3380 nlist++;
3381 endpoint_size = ALIGNED_SIZE(nlist * 2 * sizeof(*endpoint));
3382 peers_size = ALIGNED_SIZE(nlist * sizeof(*peers));
3383 indx_size = ALIGNED_SIZE(nlist * 2 * sizeof(*indx));
3384 octets = endpoint_size + peers_size + indx_size;
3385 endpoint = erealloc(endpoint, octets);
3386 peers = INC_ALIGNED_PTR(endpoint, endpoint_size);
3387 indx = INC_ALIGNED_PTR(peers, peers_size);
3388
3389 /*
3390 * Initially, we populate the island with all the rifraff peers
3391 * that happen to be lying around. Those with seriously
3392 * defective clocks are immediately booted off the island. Then,
3393 * the falsetickers are culled and put to sea. The truechimers
3394 * remaining are subject to repeated rounds where the most
3395 * unpopular at each round is kicked off. When the population
3396 * has dwindled to sys_minclock, the survivors split a million
3397 * bucks and collectively crank the chimes.
3398 */
3399 nlist = nl2 = 0; /* none yet */
3400 for (peer = peer_list; peer != NULL; peer = peer->p_link) {
3401 peer->new_status = CTL_PST_SEL_REJECT;
3402
3403 /*
3404 * Leave the island immediately if the peer is
3405 * unfit to synchronize.
3406 */
3407 if (peer_unfit(peer)) {
3408 continue;
3409 }
3410
3411 /*
3412 * If this peer is an orphan parent, elect the
3413 * one with the lowest metric defined as the
3414 * IPv4 address or the first 64 bits of the
3415 * hashed IPv6 address. To ensure convergence
3416 * on the same selected orphan, consider as
3417 * well that this system may have the lowest
3418 * metric and be the orphan parent. If this
3419 * system wins, sys_peer will be NULL to trigger
3420 * orphan mode in timer().
3421 */
3422 if (peer->stratum == sys_orphan) {
3423 u_int32 localmet;
3424 u_int32 peermet;
3425
3426 if (peer->dstadr != NULL)
3427 localmet = ntohl(peer->dstadr->addr_refid);
3428 else
3429 localmet = U_INT32_MAX;
3430 peermet = ntohl(addr2refid(&peer->srcadr));
3431 if (peermet < localmet && peermet < orphmet) {
3432 typeorphan = peer;
3433 orphmet = peermet;
3434 }
3435 continue;
3436 }
3437
3438 /*
3439 * If this peer could have the orphan parent
3440 * as a synchronization ancestor, exclude it
3441 * from selection to avoid forming a
3442 * synchronization loop within the orphan mesh,
3443 * triggering stratum climb to infinity
3444 * instability. Peers at stratum higher than
3445 * the orphan stratum could have the orphan
3446 * parent in ancestry so are excluded.
3447 * See http://bugs.ntp.org/2050
3448 */
3449 if (peer->stratum > sys_orphan) {
3450 continue;
3451 }
3452#ifdef REFCLOCK
3453 /*
3454 * The following are special cases. We deal
3455 * with them later.
3456 */
3457 if (!(peer->flags & FLAG_PREFER)) {
3458 switch (peer->refclktype) {
3459 case REFCLK_LOCALCLOCK:
3460 if ( current_time > orphwait
3461 && typelocal == NULL)
3462 typelocal = peer;
3463 continue;
3464
3465 case REFCLK_ACTS:
3466 if ( current_time > orphwait
3467 && typeacts == NULL)
3468 typeacts = peer;
3469 continue;
3470 }
3471 }
3472#endif /* REFCLOCK */
3473
3474 /*
3475 * If we get this far, the peer can stay on the
3476 * island, but does not yet have the immunity
3477 * idol.
3478 */
3479 peer->new_status = CTL_PST_SEL_SANE;
3480 f = root_distance(peer);
3481 peers[nlist].peer = peer;
3482 peers[nlist].error = peer->jitter;
3483 peers[nlist].synch = f;
3484 nlist++;
3485
3486 /*
3487 * Insert each interval endpoint on the unsorted
3488 * endpoint[] list.
3489 */
3490 e = peer->offset;
3491 endpoint[nl2].type = -1; /* lower end */
3492 endpoint[nl2].val = e - f;
3493 nl2++;
3494 endpoint[nl2].type = 1; /* upper end */
3495 endpoint[nl2].val = e + f;
3496 nl2++;
3497 }
3498 /*
3499 * Construct sorted indx[] of endpoint[] indexes ordered by
3500 * offset.
3501 */
3502 for (i = 0; i < nl2; i++)
3503 indx[i] = i;
3504 for (i = 0; i < nl2; i++) {
3505 endp = endpoint[indx[i]];
3506 e = endp.val;
3507 k = i;
3508 for (j = i + 1; j < nl2; j++) {
3509 endp = endpoint[indx[j]];
3510 if (endp.val < e) {
3511 e = endp.val;
3512 k = j;
3513 }
3514 }
3515 if (k != i) {
3516 j = indx[k];
3517 indx[k] = indx[i];
3518 indx[i] = j;
3519 }
3520 }
3521 for (i = 0; i < nl2; i++)
3522 DPRINTF(3, ("select: endpoint %2d %.6f\n",
3523 endpoint[indx[i]].type, endpoint[indx[i]].val));
3524
3525 /*
3526 * This is the actual algorithm that cleaves the truechimers
3527 * from the falsetickers. The original algorithm was described
3528 * in Keith Marzullo's dissertation, but has been modified for
3529 * better accuracy.
3530 *
3531 * Briefly put, we first assume there are no falsetickers, then
3532 * scan the candidate list first from the low end upwards and
3533 * then from the high end downwards. The scans stop when the
3534 * number of intersections equals the number of candidates less
3535 * the number of falsetickers. If this doesn't happen for a
3536 * given number of falsetickers, we bump the number of
3537 * falsetickers and try again. If the number of falsetickers
3538 * becomes equal to or greater than half the number of
3539 * candidates, the Albanians have won the Byzantine wars and
3540 * correct synchronization is not possible.
3541 *
3542 * Here, nlist is the number of candidates and allow is the
3543 * number of falsetickers. Upon exit, the truechimers are the
3544 * survivors with offsets not less than low and not greater than
3545 * high. There may be none of them.
3546 */
3547 low = 1e9;
3548 high = -1e9;
3549 for (allow = 0; 2 * allow < nlist; allow++) {
3550
3551 /*
3552 * Bound the interval (low, high) as the smallest
3553 * interval containing points from the most sources.
3554 */
3555 n = 0;
3556 for (i = 0; i < nl2; i++) {
3557 low = endpoint[indx[i]].val;
3558 n -= endpoint[indx[i]].type;
3559 if (n >= nlist - allow)
3560 break;
3561 }
3562 n = 0;
3563 for (j = nl2 - 1; j >= 0; j--) {
3564 high = endpoint[indx[j]].val;
3565 n += endpoint[indx[j]].type;
3566 if (n >= nlist - allow)
3567 break;
3568 }
3569
3570 /*
3571 * If an interval containing truechimers is found, stop.
3572 * If not, increase the number of falsetickers and go
3573 * around again.
3574 */
3575 if (high > low)
3576 break;
3577 }
3578
3579 /*
3580 * Clustering algorithm. Whittle candidate list of falsetickers,
3581 * who leave the island immediately. The TRUE peer is always a
3582 * truechimer. We must leave at least one peer to collect the
3583 * million bucks.
3584 *
3585 * We assert the correct time is contained in the interval, but
3586 * the best offset estimate for the interval might not be
3587 * contained in the interval. For this purpose, a truechimer is
3588 * defined as the midpoint of an interval that overlaps the
3589 * intersection interval.
3590 */
3591 j = 0;
3592 for (i = 0; i < nlist; i++) {
3593 double h;
3594
3595 peer = peers[i].peer;
3596 h = peers[i].synch;
3597 if (( high <= low
3598 || peer->offset + h < low
3599 || peer->offset - h > high
3600 ) && !(peer->flags & FLAG_TRUE))
3601 continue;
3602
3603#ifdef REFCLOCK
3604 /*
3605 * Eligible PPS peers must survive the intersection
3606 * algorithm. Use the first one found, but don't
3607 * include any of them in the cluster population.
3608 */
3609 if (peer->flags & FLAG_PPS) {
3610 if (typepps == NULL)
3611 typepps = peer;
3612 if (!(peer->flags & FLAG_TSTAMP_PPS))
3613 continue;
3614 }
3615#endif /* REFCLOCK */
3616
3617 if (j != i)
3618 peers[j] = peers[i];
3619 j++;
3620 }
3621 nlist = j;
3622
3623 /*
3624 * If no survivors remain at this point, check if the modem
3625 * driver, local driver or orphan parent in that order. If so,
3626 * nominate the first one found as the only survivor.
3627 * Otherwise, give up and leave the island to the rats.
3628 */
3629 if (nlist == 0) {
3630 peers[0].error = 0;
3631 peers[0].synch = sys_mindisp;
3632#ifdef REFCLOCK
3633 if (typeacts != NULL) {
3634 peers[0].peer = typeacts;
3635 nlist = 1;
3636 } else if (typelocal != NULL) {
3637 peers[0].peer = typelocal;
3638 nlist = 1;
3639 } else
3640#endif /* REFCLOCK */
3641 if (typeorphan != NULL) {
3642 peers[0].peer = typeorphan;
3643 nlist = 1;
3644 }
3645 }
3646
3647 /*
3648 * Mark the candidates at this point as truechimers.
3649 */
3650 for (i = 0; i < nlist; i++) {
3651 peers[i].peer->new_status = CTL_PST_SEL_SELCAND;
3652 DPRINTF(2, ("select: survivor %s %f\n",
3653 stoa(&peers[i].peer->srcadr), peers[i].synch));
3654 }
3655
3656 /*
3657 * Now, vote outliers off the island by select jitter weighted
3658 * by root distance. Continue voting as long as there are more
3659 * than sys_minclock survivors and the select jitter of the peer
3660 * with the worst metric is greater than the minimum peer
3661 * jitter. Stop if we are about to discard a TRUE or PREFER
3662 * peer, who of course have the immunity idol.
3663 */
3664 while (1) {
3665 d = 1e9;
3666 e = -1e9;
3667 g = 0;
3668 k = 0;
3669 for (i = 0; i < nlist; i++) {
3670 if (peers[i].error < d)
3671 d = peers[i].error;
3672 peers[i].seljit = 0;
3673 if (nlist > 1) {
3674 f = 0;
3675 for (j = 0; j < nlist; j++)
3676 f += DIFF(peers[j].peer->offset,
3677 peers[i].peer->offset);
3678 peers[i].seljit = SQRT(f / (nlist - 1));
3679 }
3680 if (peers[i].seljit * peers[i].synch > e) {
3681 g = peers[i].seljit;
3682 e = peers[i].seljit * peers[i].synch;
3683 k = i;
3684 }
3685 }
3686 g = max(g, LOGTOD(sys_precision));
3687 if ( nlist <= max(1, sys_minclock)
3688 || g <= d
3689 || ((FLAG_TRUE | FLAG_PREFER) & peers[k].peer->flags))
3690 break;
3691
3692 DPRINTF(3, ("select: drop %s seljit %.6f jit %.6f\n",
3693 ntoa(&peers[k].peer->srcadr), g, d));
3694 if (nlist > sys_maxclock)
3695 peers[k].peer->new_status = CTL_PST_SEL_EXCESS;
3696 for (j = k + 1; j < nlist; j++)
3697 peers[j - 1] = peers[j];
3698 nlist--;
3699 }
3700
3701 /*
3702 * What remains is a list usually not greater than sys_minclock
3703 * peers. Note that unsynchronized peers cannot survive this
3704 * far. Count and mark these survivors.
3705 *
3706 * While at it, count the number of leap warning bits found.
3707 * This will be used later to vote the system leap warning bit.
3708 * If a leap warning bit is found on a reference clock, the vote
3709 * is always won.
3710 *
3711 * Choose the system peer using a hybrid metric composed of the
3712 * selection jitter scaled by the root distance augmented by
3713 * stratum scaled by sys_mindisp (.001 by default). The goal of
3714 * the small stratum factor is to avoid clockhop between a
3715 * reference clock and a network peer which has a refclock and
3716 * is using an older ntpd, which does not floor sys_rootdisp at
3717 * sys_mindisp.
3718 *
3719 * In contrast, ntpd 4.2.6 and earlier used stratum primarily
3720 * in selecting the system peer, using a weight of 1 second of
3721 * additional root distance per stratum. This heavy bias is no
3722 * longer appropriate, as the scaled root distance provides a
3723 * more rational metric carrying the cumulative error budget.
3724 */
3725 e = 1e9;
3726 speer = 0;
3727 leap_vote_ins = 0;
3728 leap_vote_del = 0;
3729 for (i = 0; i < nlist; i++) {
3730 peer = peers[i].peer;
3731 peer->unreach = 0;
3732 peer->new_status = CTL_PST_SEL_SYNCCAND;
3733 sys_survivors++;
3734 if (peer->leap == LEAP_ADDSECOND) {
3735 if (peer->flags & FLAG_REFCLOCK)
3736 leap_vote_ins = nlist;
3737 else if (leap_vote_ins < nlist)
3738 leap_vote_ins++;
3739 }
3740 if (peer->leap == LEAP_DELSECOND) {
3741 if (peer->flags & FLAG_REFCLOCK)
3742 leap_vote_del = nlist;
3743 else if (leap_vote_del < nlist)
3744 leap_vote_del++;
3745 }
3746 if (peer->flags & FLAG_PREFER)
3747 sys_prefer = peer;
3748 speermet = peers[i].seljit * peers[i].synch +
3749 peer->stratum * sys_mindisp;
3750 if (speermet < e) {
3751 e = speermet;
3752 speer = i;
3753 }
3754 }
3755
3756 /*
3757 * Unless there are at least sys_misane survivors, leave the
3758 * building dark. Otherwise, do a clockhop dance. Ordinarily,
3759 * use the selected survivor speer. However, if the current
3760 * system peer is not speer, stay with the current system peer
3761 * as long as it doesn't get too old or too ugly.
3762 */
3763 if (nlist > 0 && nlist >= sys_minsane) {
3764 double x;
3765
3766 typesystem = peers[speer].peer;
3767 if (osys_peer == NULL || osys_peer == typesystem) {
3768 sys_clockhop = 0;
3769 } else if ((x = fabs(typesystem->offset -
3770 osys_peer->offset)) < sys_mindisp) {
3771 if (sys_clockhop == 0)
3772 sys_clockhop = sys_mindisp;
3773 else
3774 sys_clockhop *= .5;
3775 DPRINTF(1, ("select: clockhop %d %.6f %.6f\n",
3776 j, x, sys_clockhop));
3777 if (fabs(x) < sys_clockhop)
3778 typesystem = osys_peer;
3779 else
3780 sys_clockhop = 0;
3781 } else {
3782 sys_clockhop = 0;
3783 }
3784 }
3785
3786 /*
3787 * Mitigation rules of the game. We have the pick of the
3788 * litter in typesystem if any survivors are left. If
3789 * there is a prefer peer, use its offset and jitter.
3790 * Otherwise, use the combined offset and jitter of all kitters.
3791 */
3792 if (typesystem != NULL) {
3793 if (sys_prefer == NULL) {
3794 typesystem->new_status = CTL_PST_SEL_SYSPEER;
3795 clock_combine(peers, sys_survivors, speer);
3796 } else {
3797 typesystem = sys_prefer;
3798 sys_clockhop = 0;
3799 typesystem->new_status = CTL_PST_SEL_SYSPEER;
3800 sys_offset = typesystem->offset;
3801 sys_jitter = typesystem->jitter;
3802 }
3803 DPRINTF(1, ("select: combine offset %.9f jitter %.9f\n",
3804 sys_offset, sys_jitter));
3805 }
3806#ifdef REFCLOCK
3807 /*
3808 * If a PPS driver is lit and the combined offset is less than
3809 * 0.4 s, select the driver as the PPS peer and use its offset
3810 * and jitter. However, if this is the atom driver, use it only
3811 * if there is a prefer peer or there are no survivors and none
3812 * are required.
3813 */
3814 if ( typepps != NULL
3815 && fabs(sys_offset) < 0.4
3816 && ( typepps->refclktype != REFCLK_ATOM_PPS
3817 || ( typepps->refclktype == REFCLK_ATOM_PPS
3818 && ( sys_prefer != NULL
3819 || (typesystem == NULL && sys_minsane == 0))))) {
3820 typesystem = typepps;
3821 sys_clockhop = 0;
3822 typesystem->new_status = CTL_PST_SEL_PPS;
3823 sys_offset = typesystem->offset;
3824 sys_jitter = typesystem->jitter;
3825 DPRINTF(1, ("select: pps offset %.9f jitter %.9f\n",
3826 sys_offset, sys_jitter));
3827 }
3828#endif /* REFCLOCK */
3829
3830 /*
3831 * If there are no survivors at this point, there is no
3832 * system peer. If so and this is an old update, keep the
3833 * current statistics, but do not update the clock.
3834 */
3835 if (typesystem == NULL) {
3836 if (osys_peer != NULL) {
3837 if (sys_orphwait > 0)
3838 orphwait = current_time + sys_orphwait;
3839 report_event(EVNT_NOPEER, NULL, NULL);
3840 }
3841 sys_peer = NULL;
3842 for (peer = peer_list; peer != NULL; peer = peer->p_link)
3843 peer->status = peer->new_status;
3844 return;
3845 }
3846
3847 /*
3848 * Do not use old data, as this may mess up the clock discipline
3849 * stability.
3850 */
3851 if (typesystem->epoch <= sys_epoch)
3852 return;
3853
3854 /*
3855 * We have found the alpha male. Wind the clock.
3856 */
3857 if (osys_peer != typesystem)
3858 report_event(PEVNT_NEWPEER, typesystem, NULL);
3859 for (peer = peer_list; peer != NULL; peer = peer->p_link)
3860 peer->status = peer->new_status;
3861 clock_update(typesystem);
3862}
3863
3864
3865static void
3866clock_combine(
3867 peer_select * peers, /* survivor list */
3868 int npeers, /* number of survivors */
3869 int syspeer /* index of sys.peer */
3870 )
3871{
3872 int i;
3873 double x, y, z, w;
3874
3875 y = z = w = 0;
3876 for (i = 0; i < npeers; i++) {
3877 x = 1. / peers[i].synch;
3878 y += x;
3879 z += x * peers[i].peer->offset;
3880 w += x * DIFF(peers[i].peer->offset,
3881 peers[syspeer].peer->offset);
3882 }
3883 sys_offset = z / y;
3884 sys_jitter = SQRT(w / y + SQUARE(peers[syspeer].seljit));
3885}
3886
3887
3888/*
3889 * root_distance - compute synchronization distance from peer to root
3890 */
3891static double
3892root_distance(
3893 struct peer *peer /* peer structure pointer */
3894 )
3895{
3896 double dtemp;
3897
3898 /*
3899 * Root Distance (LAMBDA) is defined as:
3900 * (delta + DELTA)/2 + epsilon + EPSILON + D
3901 *
3902 * where:
3903 * delta is the round-trip delay
3904 * DELTA is the root delay
3905 * epsilon is the peer dispersion
3906 * + (15 usec each second)
3907 * EPSILON is the root dispersion
3908 * D is sys_jitter
3909 *
3910 * NB: Think hard about why we are using these values, and what
3911 * the alternatives are, and the various pros/cons.
3912 *
3913 * DLM thinks these are probably the best choices from any of the
3914 * other worse choices.
3915 */
3916 dtemp = (peer->delay + peer->rootdelay) / 2
3917 + peer->disp
3918 + clock_phi * (current_time - peer->update)
3919 + peer->rootdisp
3920 + peer->jitter;
3921 /*
3922 * Careful squeak here. The value returned must be greater than
3923 * the minimum root dispersion in order to avoid clockhop with
3924 * highly precise reference clocks. Note that the root distance
3925 * cannot exceed the sys_maxdist, as this is the cutoff by the
3926 * selection algorithm.
3927 */
3928 if (dtemp < sys_mindisp)
3929 dtemp = sys_mindisp;
3930 return (dtemp);
3931}
3932
3933
3934/*
3935 * peer_xmit - send packet for persistent association.
3936 */
3937static void
3938peer_xmit(
3939 struct peer *peer /* peer structure pointer */
3940 )
3941{
3942 struct pkt xpkt; /* transmit packet */
3943 size_t sendlen, authlen;
3944 keyid_t xkeyid = 0; /* transmit key ID */
3945 l_fp xmt_tx, xmt_ty;
3946
3947 if (!peer->dstadr) /* drop peers without interface */
3948 return;
3949
3950 xpkt.li_vn_mode = PKT_LI_VN_MODE(sys_leap, peer->version,
3951 peer->hmode);
3952 xpkt.stratum = STRATUM_TO_PKT(sys_stratum);
3953 xpkt.ppoll = peer->hpoll;
3954 xpkt.precision = sys_precision;
3955 xpkt.refid = sys_refid;
3956 xpkt.rootdelay = HTONS_FP(DTOFP(sys_rootdelay));
3957 xpkt.rootdisp = HTONS_FP(DTOUFP(sys_rootdisp));
3958 HTONL_FP(&sys_reftime, &xpkt.reftime);
3959 HTONL_FP(&peer->rec, &xpkt.org);
3960 HTONL_FP(&peer->dst, &xpkt.rec);
3961
3962 /*
3963 * If the received packet contains a MAC, the transmitted packet
3964 * is authenticated and contains a MAC. If not, the transmitted
3965 * packet is not authenticated.
3966 *
3967 * It is most important when autokey is in use that the local
3968 * interface IP address be known before the first packet is
3969 * sent. Otherwise, it is not possible to compute a correct MAC
3970 * the recipient will accept. Thus, the I/O semantics have to do
3971 * a little more work. In particular, the wildcard interface
3972 * might not be usable.
3973 */
3974 sendlen = LEN_PKT_NOMAC;
3975 if (
3976#ifdef AUTOKEY
3977 !(peer->flags & FLAG_SKEY) &&
3978#endif /* !AUTOKEY */
3979 peer->keyid == 0) {
3980
3981 /*
3982 * Transmit a-priori timestamps
3983 */
3984 get_systime(&xmt_tx);
3985 if (peer->flip == 0) { /* basic mode */
3986 peer->aorg = xmt_tx;
3987 HTONL_FP(&xmt_tx, &xpkt.xmt);
3988 } else { /* interleaved modes */
3989 if (peer->hmode == MODE_BROADCAST) { /* bcst */
3990 HTONL_FP(&xmt_tx, &xpkt.xmt);
3991 if (peer->flip > 0)
3992 HTONL_FP(&peer->borg,
3993 &xpkt.org);
3994 else
3995 HTONL_FP(&peer->aorg,
3996 &xpkt.org);
3997 } else { /* symmetric */
3998 if (peer->flip > 0)
3999 HTONL_FP(&peer->borg,
4000 &xpkt.xmt);
4001 else
4002 HTONL_FP(&peer->aorg,
4003 &xpkt.xmt);
4004 }
4005 }
4006 peer->t21_bytes = sendlen;
4007 sendpkt(&peer->srcadr, peer->dstadr,
4008 sys_ttl[(peer->ttl >= sys_ttlmax) ? sys_ttlmax : peer->ttl],
4009 &xpkt, sendlen);
4010 peer->sent++;
4011 peer->throttle += (1 << peer->minpoll) - 2;
4012
4013 /*
4014 * Capture a-posteriori timestamps
4015 */
4016 get_systime(&xmt_ty);
4017 if (peer->flip != 0) { /* interleaved modes */
4018 if (peer->flip > 0)
4019 peer->aorg = xmt_ty;
4020 else
4021 peer->borg = xmt_ty;
4022 peer->flip = -peer->flip;
4023 }
4024 L_SUB(&xmt_ty, &xmt_tx);
4025 LFPTOD(&xmt_ty, peer->xleave);
4026 DPRINTF(1, ("peer_xmit: at %ld %s->%s mode %d len %zu xmt %#010x.%08x\n",
4027 current_time,
4028 peer->dstadr ? stoa(&peer->dstadr->sin) : "-",
4029 stoa(&peer->srcadr), peer->hmode, sendlen,
4030 xmt_tx.l_ui, xmt_tx.l_uf));
4031 return;
4032 }
4033
4034 /*
4035 * Authentication is enabled, so the transmitted packet must be
4036 * authenticated. If autokey is enabled, fuss with the various
4037 * modes; otherwise, symmetric key cryptography is used.
4038 */
4039#ifdef AUTOKEY
4040 if (peer->flags & FLAG_SKEY) {
4041 struct exten *exten; /* extension field */
4042
4043 /*
4044 * The Public Key Dance (PKD): Cryptographic credentials
4045 * are contained in extension fields, each including a
4046 * 4-octet length/code word followed by a 4-octet
4047 * association ID and optional additional data. Optional
4048 * data includes a 4-octet data length field followed by
4049 * the data itself. Request messages are sent from a
4050 * configured association; response messages can be sent
4051 * from a configured association or can take the fast
4052 * path without ever matching an association. Response
4053 * messages have the same code as the request, but have
4054 * a response bit and possibly an error bit set. In this
4055 * implementation, a message may contain no more than
4056 * one command and one or more responses.
4057 *
4058 * Cryptographic session keys include both a public and
4059 * a private componet. Request and response messages
4060 * using extension fields are always sent with the
4061 * private component set to zero. Packets without
4062 * extension fields indlude the private component when
4063 * the session key is generated.
4064 */
4065 while (1) {
4066
4067 /*
4068 * Allocate and initialize a keylist if not
4069 * already done. Then, use the list in inverse
4070 * order, discarding keys once used. Keep the
4071 * latest key around until the next one, so
4072 * clients can use client/server packets to
4073 * compute propagation delay.
4074 *
4075 * Note that once a key is used from the list,
4076 * it is retained in the key cache until the
4077 * next key is used. This is to allow a client
4078 * to retrieve the encrypted session key
4079 * identifier to verify authenticity.
4080 *
4081 * If for some reason a key is no longer in the
4082 * key cache, a birthday has happened or the key
4083 * has expired, so the pseudo-random sequence is
4084 * broken. In that case, purge the keylist and
4085 * regenerate it.
4086 */
4087 if (peer->keynumber == 0)
4088 make_keylist(peer, peer->dstadr);
4089 else
4090 peer->keynumber--;
4091 xkeyid = peer->keylist[peer->keynumber];
4092 if (authistrusted(xkeyid))
4093 break;
4094 else
4095 key_expire(peer);
4096 }
4097 peer->keyid = xkeyid;
4098 exten = NULL;
4099 switch (peer->hmode) {
4100
4101 /*
4102 * In broadcast server mode the autokey values are
4103 * required by the broadcast clients. Push them when a
4104 * new keylist is generated; otherwise, push the
4105 * association message so the client can request them at
4106 * other times.
4107 */
4108 case MODE_BROADCAST:
4109 if (peer->flags & FLAG_ASSOC)
4110 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_AUTO |
4111 CRYPTO_RESP, peer->associd, NULL);
4112 else
4113 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_ASSOC |
4114 CRYPTO_RESP, peer->associd, NULL);
4115 break;
4116
4117 /*
4118 * In symmetric modes the parameter, certificate,
4119 * identity, cookie and autokey exchanges are
4120 * required. The leapsecond exchange is optional. But, a
4121 * peer will not believe the other peer until the other
4122 * peer has synchronized, so the certificate exchange
4123 * might loop until then. If a peer finds a broken
4124 * autokey sequence, it uses the autokey exchange to
4125 * retrieve the autokey values. In any case, if a new
4126 * keylist is generated, the autokey values are pushed.
4127 */
4128 case MODE_ACTIVE:
4129 case MODE_PASSIVE:
4130
4131 /*
4132 * Parameter, certificate and identity.
4133 */
4134 if (!peer->crypto)
4135 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_ASSOC,
4136 peer->associd, hostval.ptr);
4137 else if (!(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_CERT))
4138 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_CERT,
4139 peer->associd, peer->issuer);
4140 else if (!(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_VRFY))
4141 exten = crypto_args(peer,
4142 crypto_ident(peer), peer->associd,
4143 NULL);
4144
4145 /*
4146 * Cookie and autokey. We request the cookie
4147 * only when the this peer and the other peer
4148 * are synchronized. But, this peer needs the
4149 * autokey values when the cookie is zero. Any
4150 * time we regenerate the key list, we offer the
4151 * autokey values without being asked. If for
4152 * some reason either peer finds a broken
4153 * autokey sequence, the autokey exchange is
4154 * used to retrieve the autokey values.
4155 */
4156 else if ( sys_leap != LEAP_NOTINSYNC
4157 && peer->leap != LEAP_NOTINSYNC
4158 && !(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_COOK))
4159 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_COOK,
4160 peer->associd, NULL);
4161 else if (!(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_AUTO))
4162 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_AUTO,
4163 peer->associd, NULL);
4164 else if ( peer->flags & FLAG_ASSOC
4165 && peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_SIGN)
4166 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_AUTO |
4167 CRYPTO_RESP, peer->assoc, NULL);
4168
4169 /*
4170 * Wait for clock sync, then sign the
4171 * certificate and retrieve the leapsecond
4172 * values.
4173 */
4174 else if (sys_leap == LEAP_NOTINSYNC)
4175 break;
4176
4177 else if (!(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_SIGN))
4178 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_SIGN,
4179 peer->associd, hostval.ptr);
4180 else if (!(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_LEAP))
4181 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_LEAP,
4182 peer->associd, NULL);
4183 break;
4184
4185 /*
4186 * In client mode the parameter, certificate, identity,
4187 * cookie and sign exchanges are required. The
4188 * leapsecond exchange is optional. If broadcast client
4189 * mode the same exchanges are required, except that the
4190 * autokey exchange is substitutes for the cookie
4191 * exchange, since the cookie is always zero. If the
4192 * broadcast client finds a broken autokey sequence, it
4193 * uses the autokey exchange to retrieve the autokey
4194 * values.
4195 */
4196 case MODE_CLIENT:
4197
4198 /*
4199 * Parameter, certificate and identity.
4200 */
4201 if (!peer->crypto)
4202 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_ASSOC,
4203 peer->associd, hostval.ptr);
4204 else if (!(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_CERT))
4205 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_CERT,
4206 peer->associd, peer->issuer);
4207 else if (!(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_VRFY))
4208 exten = crypto_args(peer,
4209 crypto_ident(peer), peer->associd,
4210 NULL);
4211
4212 /*
4213 * Cookie and autokey. These are requests, but
4214 * we use the peer association ID with autokey
4215 * rather than our own.
4216 */
4217 else if (!(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_COOK))
4218 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_COOK,
4219 peer->associd, NULL);
4220 else if (!(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_AUTO))
4221 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_AUTO,
4222 peer->assoc, NULL);
4223
4224 /*
4225 * Wait for clock sync, then sign the
4226 * certificate and retrieve the leapsecond
4227 * values.
4228 */
4229 else if (sys_leap == LEAP_NOTINSYNC)
4230 break;
4231
4232 else if (!(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_SIGN))
4233 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_SIGN,
4234 peer->associd, hostval.ptr);
4235 else if (!(peer->crypto & CRYPTO_FLAG_LEAP))
4236 exten = crypto_args(peer, CRYPTO_LEAP,
4237 peer->associd, NULL);
4238 break;
4239 }
4240
4241 /*
4242 * Add a queued extension field if present. This is
4243 * always a request message, so the reply ID is already
4244 * in the message. If an error occurs, the error bit is
4245 * lit in the response.
4246 */
4247 if (peer->cmmd != NULL) {
4248 u_int32 temp32;
4249
4250 temp32 = CRYPTO_RESP;
4251 peer->cmmd->opcode |= htonl(temp32);
4252 sendlen += crypto_xmit(peer, &xpkt, NULL,
4253 sendlen, peer->cmmd, 0);
4254 free(peer->cmmd);
4255 peer->cmmd = NULL;
4256 }
4257
4258 /*
4259 * Add an extension field created above. All but the
4260 * autokey response message are request messages.
4261 */
4262 if (exten != NULL) {
4263 if (exten->opcode != 0)
4264 sendlen += crypto_xmit(peer, &xpkt,
4265 NULL, sendlen, exten, 0);
4266 free(exten);
4267 }
4268
4269 /*
4270 * Calculate the next session key. Since extension
4271 * fields are present, the cookie value is zero.
4272 */
4273 if (sendlen > (int)LEN_PKT_NOMAC) {
4274 session_key(&peer->dstadr->sin, &peer->srcadr,
4275 xkeyid, 0, 2);
4276 }
4277 }
4278#endif /* AUTOKEY */
4279
4280 /*
4281 * Transmit a-priori timestamps
4282 */
4283 get_systime(&xmt_tx);
4284 if (peer->flip == 0) { /* basic mode */
4285 peer->aorg = xmt_tx;
4286 HTONL_FP(&xmt_tx, &xpkt.xmt);
4287 } else { /* interleaved modes */
4288 if (peer->hmode == MODE_BROADCAST) { /* bcst */
4289 HTONL_FP(&xmt_tx, &xpkt.xmt);
4290 if (peer->flip > 0)
4291 HTONL_FP(&peer->borg, &xpkt.org);
4292 else
4293 HTONL_FP(&peer->aorg, &xpkt.org);
4294 } else { /* symmetric */
4295 if (peer->flip > 0)
4296 HTONL_FP(&peer->borg, &xpkt.xmt);
4297 else
4298 HTONL_FP(&peer->aorg, &xpkt.xmt);
4299 }
4300 }
4301 xkeyid = peer->keyid;
4302 authlen = authencrypt(xkeyid, (u_int32 *)&xpkt, sendlen);
4303 if (authlen == 0) {
4304 report_event(PEVNT_AUTH, peer, "no key");
4305 peer->flash |= TEST5; /* auth error */
4306 peer->badauth++;
4307 return;
4308 }
4309 sendlen += authlen;
4310#ifdef AUTOKEY
4311 if (xkeyid > NTP_MAXKEY)
4312 authtrust(xkeyid, 0);
4313#endif /* AUTOKEY */
4314 if (sendlen > sizeof(xpkt)) {
4315 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "peer_xmit: buffer overflow %zu", sendlen);
4316 exit (-1);
4317 }
4318 peer->t21_bytes = sendlen;
4319 sendpkt(&peer->srcadr, peer->dstadr,
4320 sys_ttl[(peer->ttl >= sys_ttlmax) ? sys_ttlmax : peer->ttl],
4321 &xpkt, sendlen);
4322 peer->sent++;
4323 peer->throttle += (1 << peer->minpoll) - 2;
4324
4325 /*
4326 * Capture a-posteriori timestamps
4327 */
4328 get_systime(&xmt_ty);
4329 if (peer->flip != 0) { /* interleaved modes */
4330 if (peer->flip > 0)
4331 peer->aorg = xmt_ty;
4332 else
4333 peer->borg = xmt_ty;
4334 peer->flip = -peer->flip;
4335 }
4336 L_SUB(&xmt_ty, &xmt_tx);
4337 LFPTOD(&xmt_ty, peer->xleave);
4338#ifdef AUTOKEY
4339 DPRINTF(1, ("peer_xmit: at %ld %s->%s mode %d keyid %08x len %zu index %d\n",
4340 current_time, latoa(peer->dstadr),
4341 ntoa(&peer->srcadr), peer->hmode, xkeyid, sendlen,
4342 peer->keynumber));
4343#else /* !AUTOKEY follows */
4344 DPRINTF(1, ("peer_xmit: at %ld %s->%s mode %d keyid %08x len %zu\n",
4345 current_time, peer->dstadr ?
4346 ntoa(&peer->dstadr->sin) : "-",
4347 ntoa(&peer->srcadr), peer->hmode, xkeyid, sendlen));
4348#endif /* !AUTOKEY */
4349
4350 return;
4351}
4352
4353
4354#ifdef LEAP_SMEAR
4355
4356static void
4357leap_smear_add_offs(
4358 l_fp *t,
4359 l_fp *t_recv
4360 )
4361{
4362
4363 L_ADD(t, &leap_smear.offset);
4364
4365 /*
4366 ** XXX: Should the smear be added to the root dispersion?
4367 */
4368
4369 return;
4370}
4371
4372#endif /* LEAP_SMEAR */
4373
4374
4375/*
4376 * fast_xmit - Send packet for nonpersistent association. Note that
4377 * neither the source or destination can be a broadcast address.
4378 */
4379static void
4380fast_xmit(
4381 struct recvbuf *rbufp, /* receive packet pointer */
4382 int xmode, /* receive mode */
4383 keyid_t xkeyid, /* transmit key ID */
4384 int flags /* restrict mask */
4385 )
4386{
4387 struct pkt xpkt; /* transmit packet structure */
4388 struct pkt *rpkt; /* receive packet structure */
4389 l_fp xmt_tx, xmt_ty;
4390 size_t sendlen;
4391#ifdef AUTOKEY
4392 u_int32 temp32;
4393#endif
4394
4395 /*
4396 * Initialize transmit packet header fields from the receive
4397 * buffer provided. We leave the fields intact as received, but
4398 * set the peer poll at the maximum of the receive peer poll and
4399 * the system minimum poll (ntp_minpoll). This is for KoD rate
4400 * control and not strictly specification compliant, but doesn't
4401 * break anything.
4402 *
4403 * If the gazinta was from a multicast address, the gazoutta
4404 * must go out another way.
4405 */
4406 rpkt = &rbufp->recv_pkt;
4407 if (rbufp->dstadr->flags & INT_MCASTOPEN)
4408 rbufp->dstadr = findinterface(&rbufp->recv_srcadr);
4409
4410 /*
4411 * If this is a kiss-o'-death (KoD) packet, show leap
4412 * unsynchronized, stratum zero, reference ID the four-character
4413 * kiss code and system root delay. Note we don't reveal the
4414 * local time, so these packets can't be used for
4415 * synchronization.
4416 */
4417 if (flags & RES_KOD) {
4418 sys_kodsent++;
4419 xpkt.li_vn_mode = PKT_LI_VN_MODE(LEAP_NOTINSYNC,
4420 PKT_VERSION(rpkt->li_vn_mode), xmode);
4421 xpkt.stratum = STRATUM_PKT_UNSPEC;
4422 xpkt.ppoll = max(rpkt->ppoll, ntp_minpoll);
4423 xpkt.precision = rpkt->precision;
4424 memcpy(&xpkt.refid, "RATE", 4);
4425 xpkt.rootdelay = rpkt->rootdelay;
4426 xpkt.rootdisp = rpkt->rootdisp;
4427 xpkt.reftime = rpkt->reftime;
4428 xpkt.org = rpkt->xmt;
4429 xpkt.rec = rpkt->xmt;
4430 xpkt.xmt = rpkt->xmt;
4431
4432 /*
4433 * This is a normal packet. Use the system variables.
4434 */
4435 } else {
4436#ifdef LEAP_SMEAR
4437 /*
4438 * Make copies of the variables which can be affected by smearing.
4439 */
4440 l_fp this_ref_time;
4441 l_fp this_recv_time;
4442#endif
4443
4444 /*
4445 * If we are inside the leap smear interval we add the current smear offset to
4446 * the packet receive time, to the packet transmit time, and eventually to the
4447 * reftime to make sure the reftime isn't later than the transmit/receive times.
4448 */
4449 xpkt.li_vn_mode = PKT_LI_VN_MODE(xmt_leap,
4450 PKT_VERSION(rpkt->li_vn_mode), xmode);
4451
4452 xpkt.stratum = STRATUM_TO_PKT(sys_stratum);
4453 xpkt.ppoll = max(rpkt->ppoll, ntp_minpoll);
4454 xpkt.precision = sys_precision;
4455 xpkt.refid = sys_refid;
4456 xpkt.rootdelay = HTONS_FP(DTOFP(sys_rootdelay));
4457 xpkt.rootdisp = HTONS_FP(DTOUFP(sys_rootdisp));
4458
4459#ifdef LEAP_SMEAR
4460 this_ref_time = sys_reftime;
4461 if (leap_smear.in_progress) {
4462 leap_smear_add_offs(&this_ref_time, NULL);
4463 xpkt.refid = convertLFPToRefID(leap_smear.offset);
4464 DPRINTF(2, ("fast_xmit: leap_smear.in_progress: refid %8x, smear %s\n",
4465 ntohl(xpkt.refid),
4466 lfptoa(&leap_smear.offset, 8)
4467 ));
4468 }
4469 HTONL_FP(&this_ref_time, &xpkt.reftime);
4470#else
4471 HTONL_FP(&sys_reftime, &xpkt.reftime);
4472#endif
4473
4474 xpkt.org = rpkt->xmt;
4475
4476#ifdef LEAP_SMEAR
4477 this_recv_time = rbufp->recv_time;
4478 if (leap_smear.in_progress)
4479 leap_smear_add_offs(&this_recv_time, NULL);
4480 HTONL_FP(&this_recv_time, &xpkt.rec);
4481#else
4482 HTONL_FP(&rbufp->recv_time, &xpkt.rec);
4483#endif
4484
4485 get_systime(&xmt_tx);
4486#ifdef LEAP_SMEAR
4487 if (leap_smear.in_progress)
4488 leap_smear_add_offs(&xmt_tx, &this_recv_time);
4489#endif
4490 HTONL_FP(&xmt_tx, &xpkt.xmt);
4491 }
4492
4493#ifdef HAVE_NTP_SIGND
4494 if (flags & RES_MSSNTP) {
4495 send_via_ntp_signd(rbufp, xmode, xkeyid, flags, &xpkt);
4496 return;
4497 }
4498#endif /* HAVE_NTP_SIGND */
4499
4500 /*
4501 * If the received packet contains a MAC, the transmitted packet
4502 * is authenticated and contains a MAC. If not, the transmitted
4503 * packet is not authenticated.
4504 */
4505 sendlen = LEN_PKT_NOMAC;
4506 if ((size_t)rbufp->recv_length == sendlen) {
4507 sendpkt(&rbufp->recv_srcadr, rbufp->dstadr, 0, &xpkt,
4508 sendlen);
4509 DPRINTF(1, ("fast_xmit: at %ld %s->%s mode %d len %lu\n",
4510 current_time, stoa(&rbufp->dstadr->sin),
4511 stoa(&rbufp->recv_srcadr), xmode,
4512 (u_long)sendlen));
4513 return;
4514 }
4515
4516 /*
4517 * The received packet contains a MAC, so the transmitted packet
4518 * must be authenticated. For symmetric key cryptography, use
4519 * the predefined and trusted symmetric keys to generate the
4520 * cryptosum. For autokey cryptography, use the server private
4521 * value to generate the cookie, which is unique for every
4522 * source-destination-key ID combination.
4523 */
4524#ifdef AUTOKEY
4525 if (xkeyid > NTP_MAXKEY) {
4526 keyid_t cookie;
4527
4528 /*
4529 * The only way to get here is a reply to a legitimate
4530 * client request message, so the mode must be
4531 * MODE_SERVER. If an extension field is present, there
4532 * can be only one and that must be a command. Do what
4533 * needs, but with private value of zero so the poor
4534 * jerk can decode it. If no extension field is present,
4535 * use the cookie to generate the session key.
4536 */
4537 cookie = session_key(&rbufp->recv_srcadr,
4538 &rbufp->dstadr->sin, 0, sys_private, 0);
4539 if ((size_t)rbufp->recv_length > sendlen + MAX_MAC_LEN) {
4540 session_key(&rbufp->dstadr->sin,
4541 &rbufp->recv_srcadr, xkeyid, 0, 2);
4542 temp32 = CRYPTO_RESP;
4543 rpkt->exten[0] |= htonl(temp32);
4544 sendlen += crypto_xmit(NULL, &xpkt, rbufp,
4545 sendlen, (struct exten *)rpkt->exten,
4546 cookie);
4547 } else {
4548 session_key(&rbufp->dstadr->sin,
4549 &rbufp->recv_srcadr, xkeyid, cookie, 2);
4550 }
4551 }
4552#endif /* AUTOKEY */
4553 get_systime(&xmt_tx);
4554 sendlen += authencrypt(xkeyid, (u_int32 *)&xpkt, sendlen);
4555#ifdef AUTOKEY
4556 if (xkeyid > NTP_MAXKEY)
4557 authtrust(xkeyid, 0);
4558#endif /* AUTOKEY */
4559 sendpkt(&rbufp->recv_srcadr, rbufp->dstadr, 0, &xpkt, sendlen);
4560 get_systime(&xmt_ty);
4561 L_SUB(&xmt_ty, &xmt_tx);
4562 sys_authdelay = xmt_ty;
4563 DPRINTF(1, ("fast_xmit: at %ld %s->%s mode %d keyid %08x len %lu\n",
4564 current_time, ntoa(&rbufp->dstadr->sin),
4565 ntoa(&rbufp->recv_srcadr), xmode, xkeyid,
4566 (u_long)sendlen));
4567}
4568
4569
4570/*
4571 * pool_xmit - resolve hostname or send unicast solicitation for pool.
4572 */
4573static void
4574pool_xmit(
4575 struct peer *pool /* pool solicitor association */
4576 )
4577{
4578#ifdef WORKER
4579 struct pkt xpkt; /* transmit packet structure */
4580 struct addrinfo hints;
4581 int rc;
4582 struct interface * lcladr;
4583 sockaddr_u * rmtadr;
4584 r4addr r4a;
4585 int restrict_mask;
4586 struct peer * p;
4587 l_fp xmt_tx;
4588
4589 if (NULL == pool->ai) {
4590 if (pool->addrs != NULL) {
4591 /* free() is used with copy_addrinfo_list() */
4592 free(pool->addrs);
4593 pool->addrs = NULL;
4594 }
4595 ZERO(hints);
4596 hints.ai_family = AF(&pool->srcadr);
4597 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
4598 hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_UDP;
4599 /* ignore getaddrinfo_sometime() errors, we will retry */
4600 rc = getaddrinfo_sometime(
4601 pool->hostname,
4602 "ntp",
4603 &hints,
4604 0, /* no retry */
4605 &pool_name_resolved,
4606 (void *)(intptr_t)pool->associd);
4607 if (!rc)
4608 DPRINTF(1, ("pool DNS lookup %s started\n",
4609 pool->hostname));
4610 else
4611 msyslog(LOG_ERR,
4612 "unable to start pool DNS %s: %m",
4613 pool->hostname);
4614 return;
4615 }
4616
4617 do {
4618 /* copy_addrinfo_list ai_addr points to a sockaddr_u */
4619 rmtadr = (sockaddr_u *)(void *)pool->ai->ai_addr;
4620 pool->ai = pool->ai->ai_next;
4621 p = findexistingpeer(rmtadr, NULL, NULL, MODE_CLIENT, 0, NULL);
4622 } while (p != NULL && pool->ai != NULL);
4623 if (p != NULL)
4624 return; /* out of addresses, re-query DNS next poll */
4625 restrictions(rmtadr, &r4a);
4626 restrict_mask = r4a.rflags;
4627 if (RES_FLAGS & restrict_mask)
4628 restrict_source(rmtadr, 0,
4629 current_time + POOL_SOLICIT_WINDOW + 1);
4630 lcladr = findinterface(rmtadr);
4631 memset(&xpkt, 0, sizeof(xpkt));
4632 xpkt.li_vn_mode = PKT_LI_VN_MODE(sys_leap, pool->version,
4633 MODE_CLIENT);
4634 xpkt.stratum = STRATUM_TO_PKT(sys_stratum);
4635 xpkt.ppoll = pool->hpoll;
4636 xpkt.precision = sys_precision;
4637 xpkt.refid = sys_refid;
4638 xpkt.rootdelay = HTONS_FP(DTOFP(sys_rootdelay));
4639 xpkt.rootdisp = HTONS_FP(DTOUFP(sys_rootdisp));
4640 HTONL_FP(&sys_reftime, &xpkt.reftime);
4641 get_systime(&xmt_tx);
4642 pool->aorg = xmt_tx;
4643 HTONL_FP(&xmt_tx, &xpkt.xmt);
4644 sendpkt(rmtadr, lcladr,
4645 sys_ttl[(pool->ttl >= sys_ttlmax) ? sys_ttlmax : pool->ttl],
4646 &xpkt, LEN_PKT_NOMAC);
4647 pool->sent++;
4648 pool->throttle += (1 << pool->minpoll) - 2;
4649 DPRINTF(1, ("pool_xmit: at %ld %s->%s pool\n",
4650 current_time, latoa(lcladr), stoa(rmtadr)));
4651 msyslog(LOG_INFO, "Soliciting pool server %s", stoa(rmtadr));
4652#endif /* WORKER */
4653}
4654
4655
4656#ifdef AUTOKEY
4657 /*
4658 * group_test - test if this is the same group
4659 *
4660 * host assoc return action
4661 * none none 0 mobilize *
4662 * none group 0 mobilize *
4663 * group none 0 mobilize *
4664 * group group 1 mobilize
4665 * group different 1 ignore
4666 * * ignore if notrust
4667 */
4668int
4669group_test(
4670 char *grp,
4671 char *ident
4672 )
4673{
4674 if (grp == NULL)
4675 return (0);
4676
4677 if (strcmp(grp, sys_groupname) == 0)
4678 return (0);
4679
4680 if (ident == NULL)
4681 return (1);
4682
4683 if (strcmp(grp, ident) == 0)
4684 return (0);
4685
4686 return (1);
4687}
4688#endif /* AUTOKEY */

4691#ifdef WORKER
4692void
4693pool_name_resolved(
4694 int rescode,
4695 int gai_errno,
4696 void * context,
4697 const char * name,
4698 const char * service,
4699 const struct addrinfo * hints,
4700 const struct addrinfo * res
4701 )
4702{
4703 struct peer * pool; /* pool solicitor association */
4704 associd_t assoc;
4705
4706 if (rescode) {
4707 msyslog(LOG_ERR,
4708 "error resolving pool %s: %s (%d)",
4709 name, gai_strerror(rescode), rescode);
4710 return;
4711 }
4712
4713 assoc = (associd_t)(intptr_t)context;
4714 pool = findpeerbyassoc(assoc);
4715 if (NULL == pool) {
4716 msyslog(LOG_ERR,
4717 "Could not find assoc %u for pool DNS %s",
4718 assoc, name);
4719 return;
4720 }
4721 DPRINTF(1, ("pool DNS %s completed\n", name));
4722 pool->addrs = copy_addrinfo_list(res);
4723 pool->ai = pool->addrs;
4724 pool_xmit(pool);
4725
4726}

4731/*
4732 * key_expire - purge the key list
4733 */
4734void
4735key_expire(
4736 struct peer *peer /* peer structure pointer */
4737 )
4738{
4739 int i;
4740
4741 if (peer->keylist != NULL) {
4742 for (i = 0; i <= peer->keynumber; i++)
4743 authtrust(peer->keylist[i], 0);
4744 free(peer->keylist);
4745 peer->keylist = NULL;
4746 }
4747 value_free(&peer->sndval);
4748 peer->keynumber = 0;
4749 peer->flags &= ~FLAG_ASSOC;
4750 DPRINTF(1, ("key_expire: at %lu associd %d\n", current_time,
4751 peer->associd));
4752}
4753#endif /* AUTOKEY */

4756/*
4757 * local_refid(peer) - check peer refid to avoid selecting peers
4758 * currently synced to this ntpd.
4759 */
4760static int
4761local_refid(
4762 struct peer * p
4763 )
4764{
4765 endpt * unicast_ep;
4766
4767 if (p->dstadr != NULL && !(INT_MCASTIF & p->dstadr->flags))
4768 unicast_ep = p->dstadr;
4769 else
4770 unicast_ep = findinterface(&p->srcadr);
4771
4772 if (unicast_ep != NULL && p->refid == unicast_ep->addr_refid)
4773 return TRUE;
4774 else
4775 return FALSE;
4776}
4777
4778
4779/*
4780 * Determine if the peer is unfit for synchronization
4781 *
4782 * A peer is unfit for synchronization if
4783 * > TEST10 bad leap or stratum below floor or at or above ceiling
4784 * > TEST11 root distance exceeded for remote peer
4785 * > TEST12 a direct or indirect synchronization loop would form
4786 * > TEST13 unreachable or noselect
4787 */
4788int /* FALSE if fit, TRUE if unfit */
4789peer_unfit(
4790 struct peer *peer /* peer structure pointer */
4791 )
4792{
4793 int rval = 0;
4794
4795 /*
4796 * A stratum error occurs if (1) the server has never been
4797 * synchronized, (2) the server stratum is below the floor or
4798 * greater than or equal to the ceiling.
4799 */
4800 if ( peer->leap == LEAP_NOTINSYNC
4801 || peer->stratum < sys_floor
4802 || peer->stratum >= sys_ceiling) {
4803 rval |= TEST10; /* bad synch or stratum */
4804 }
4805
4806 /*
4807 * A distance error for a remote peer occurs if the root
4808 * distance is greater than or equal to the distance threshold
4809 * plus the increment due to one host poll interval.
4810 */
4811 if ( !(peer->flags & FLAG_REFCLOCK)
4812 && root_distance(peer) >= sys_maxdist
4813 + clock_phi * ULOGTOD(peer->hpoll)) {
4814 rval |= TEST11; /* distance exceeded */
4815 }
4816
4817 /*
4818 * A loop error occurs if the remote peer is synchronized to the
4819 * local peer or if the remote peer is synchronized to the same
4820 * server as the local peer but only if the remote peer is
4821 * neither a reference clock nor an orphan.
4822 */
4823 if (peer->stratum > 1 && local_refid(peer)) {
4824 rval |= TEST12; /* synchronization loop */
4825 }
4826
4827 /*
4828 * An unreachable error occurs if the server is unreachable or
4829 * the noselect bit is set.
4830 */
4831 if (!peer->reach || (peer->flags & FLAG_NOSELECT)) {
4832 rval |= TEST13; /* unreachable */
4833 }
4834
4835 peer->flash &= ~PEER_TEST_MASK;
4836 peer->flash |= rval;
4837 return (rval);
4838}
4839
4840
4841/*
4842 * Find the precision of this particular machine
4843 */
4844#define MINSTEP 20e-9 /* minimum clock increment (s) */
4845#define MAXSTEP 1 /* maximum clock increment (s) */
4846#define MINCHANGES 12 /* minimum number of step samples */
4847#define MAXLOOPS ((int)(1. / MINSTEP)) /* avoid infinite loop */
4848
4849/*
4850 * This routine measures the system precision defined as the minimum of
4851 * a sequence of differences between successive readings of the system
4852 * clock. However, if a difference is less than MINSTEP, the clock has
4853 * been read more than once during a clock tick and the difference is
4854 * ignored. We set MINSTEP greater than zero in case something happens
4855 * like a cache miss, and to tolerate underlying system clocks which
4856 * ensure each reading is strictly greater than prior readings while
4857 * using an underlying stepping (not interpolated) clock.
4858 *
4859 * sys_tick and sys_precision represent the time to read the clock for
4860 * systems with high-precision clocks, and the tick interval or step
4861 * size for lower-precision stepping clocks.
4862 *
4863 * This routine also measures the time to read the clock on stepping
4864 * system clocks by counting the number of readings between changes of
4865 * the underlying clock. With either type of clock, the minimum time
4866 * to read the clock is saved as sys_fuzz, and used to ensure the
4867 * get_systime() readings always increase and are fuzzed below sys_fuzz.
4868 */
4869void
4870measure_precision(void)
4871{
4872 /*
4873 * With sys_fuzz set to zero, get_systime() fuzzing of low bits
4874 * is effectively disabled. trunc_os_clock is FALSE to disable
4875 * get_ostime() simulation of a low-precision system clock.
4876 */
4877 set_sys_fuzz(0.);
4878 trunc_os_clock = FALSE;
4879 measured_tick = measure_tick_fuzz();
4880 set_sys_tick_precision(measured_tick);
4881 msyslog(LOG_INFO, "proto: precision = %.3f usec (%d)",
4882 sys_tick * 1e6, sys_precision);
4883 if (sys_fuzz < sys_tick) {
4884 msyslog(LOG_NOTICE, "proto: fuzz beneath %.3f usec",
4885 sys_fuzz * 1e6);
4886 }
4887}
4888
4889
4890/*
4891 * measure_tick_fuzz()
4892 *
4893 * measures the minimum time to read the clock (stored in sys_fuzz)
4894 * and returns the tick, the larger of the minimum increment observed
4895 * between successive clock readings and the time to read the clock.
4896 */
4897double
4898measure_tick_fuzz(void)
4899{
4900 l_fp minstep; /* MINSTEP as l_fp */
4901 l_fp val; /* current seconds fraction */
4902 l_fp last; /* last seconds fraction */
4903 l_fp ldiff; /* val - last */
4904 double tick; /* computed tick value */
4905 double diff;
4906 long repeats;
4907 long max_repeats;
4908 int changes;
4909 int i; /* log2 precision */
4910
4911 tick = MAXSTEP;
4912 max_repeats = 0;
4913 repeats = 0;
4914 changes = 0;
4915 DTOLFP(MINSTEP, &minstep);
4916 get_systime(&last);
4917 for (i = 0; i < MAXLOOPS && changes < MINCHANGES; i++) {
4918 get_systime(&val);
4919 ldiff = val;
4920 L_SUB(&ldiff, &last);
4921 last = val;
4922 if (L_ISGT(&ldiff, &minstep)) {
4923 max_repeats = max(repeats, max_repeats);
4924 repeats = 0;
4925 changes++;
4926 LFPTOD(&ldiff, diff);
4927 tick = min(diff, tick);
4928 } else {
4929 repeats++;
4930 }
4931 }
4932 if (changes < MINCHANGES) {
4933 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "Fatal error: precision could not be measured (MINSTEP too large?)");
4934 exit(1);
4935 }
4936
4937 if (0 == max_repeats) {
4938 set_sys_fuzz(tick);
4939 } else {
4940 set_sys_fuzz(tick / max_repeats);
4941 }
4942
4943 return tick;
4944}
4945
4946
4947void
4948set_sys_tick_precision(
4949 double tick
4950 )
4951{
4952 int i;
4953
4954 if (tick > 1.) {
4955 msyslog(LOG_ERR,
4956 "unsupported tick %.3f > 1s ignored", tick);
4957 return;
4958 }
4959 if (tick < measured_tick) {
4960 msyslog(LOG_ERR,
4961 "proto: tick %.3f less than measured tick %.3f, ignored",
4962 tick, measured_tick);
4963 return;
4964 } else if (tick > measured_tick) {
4965 trunc_os_clock = TRUE;
4966 msyslog(LOG_NOTICE,
4967 "proto: truncating system clock to multiples of %.9f",
4968 tick);
4969 }
4970 sys_tick = tick;
4971
4972 /*
4973 * Find the nearest power of two.
4974 */
4975 for (i = 0; tick <= 1; i--)
4976 tick *= 2;
4977 if (tick - 1 > 1 - tick / 2)
4978 i++;
4979
4980 sys_precision = (s_char)i;
4981}
4982

4984/*
4985 * init_proto - initialize the protocol module's data
4986 */
4987void
4988init_proto(void)
4989{
4990 l_fp dummy;
4991 int i;
4992
4993 /*
4994 * Fill in the sys_* stuff. Default is don't listen to
4995 * broadcasting, require authentication.
4996 */
4997 set_sys_leap(LEAP_NOTINSYNC);
4998 sys_stratum = STRATUM_UNSPEC;
4999 memcpy(&sys_refid, "INIT", 4);
5000 sys_peer = NULL;
5001 sys_rootdelay = 0;
5002 sys_rootdisp = 0;
5003 L_CLR(&sys_reftime);
5004 sys_jitter = 0;
5005 measure_precision();
5006 get_systime(&dummy);
5007 sys_survivors = 0;
5008 sys_manycastserver = 0;
5009 sys_bclient = 0;
5010 sys_bdelay = BDELAY_DEFAULT; /*[Bug 3031] delay cutoff */
5011 sys_authenticate = 1;
5012 sys_stattime = current_time;
5013 orphwait = current_time + sys_orphwait;
5014 proto_clr_stats();
5015 for (i = 0; i < MAX_TTL; ++i)
5016 sys_ttl[i] = (u_char)((i * 256) / MAX_TTL);
5017 sys_ttlmax = (MAX_TTL - 1);
5018 hardpps_enable = 0;
5019 stats_control = 1;
5020}
